definitions.definition: to (cause something to) move somewhere by turning over and over or from side to side:
examples: The vase rolled off the edge of the table and smashed.

definitions.definition: to move somewhere easily and without sudden movements:
examples: A tear rolled down his cheek.

definitions.definition: If an aircraft or a ship rolls, it leans to one side and then to the other because of the wind or waves.
If a machine is rolling, it is operating:
examples: Just as the television cameras started rolling, it began to pour down with rain.

definitions.definition: If you roll your eyes, you move them so that you are looking up, to show that you consider someone or something stupid or silly:
examples: When he suggested they should buy a new car, she rolled her eyes in disbelief.

definitions.definition: a piece of film, paper, or cloth that is rolled into the shape of a tube:
If a person or animal has rolls of fat on their body, he, she, or it is very fat:
examples: The dog had rolls of fat along its neck.
